Experts who track domestic terrorism and: wing groups organizing nationwide as "hit squads" to oppose President Trump's reelection.
Mark Bray: a historian and part-time lecturer at Rutgers University, dismisses Caputo's claim as an "outlandish, unproven argument" aimed at serving the Trump 2020 campaign.
While left: wing groups like Redneck Revolt and the Socialist Rifle Association have been involved in violence, there is no evidence that they are being trained or organizing underground to stage an armed revolt.
The Network Contagion Research Institute: wing groups were growing their online networks and occasionally sharing content with depictions of violence, but this does not support the claim of organized hit squads.
